name: Dorothy L. Sayers Characters Quiz | Dorothy L. Sayers | 10 Questions

questions.text: In which of these books does Gerald, who is the Duke of Denver and Lord Peter's brother, feature most prominently?
questions.explanation:
Clouds of Witness.

	Gerald is suspected of murdering his sister Mary's fiancé. But Lord Peter saves the day by unraveling the case.

questions.text: "Strong Poison", "Have His Carcass", and "Gaudy Night". Who (besides Lord Peter and Bunter) features *very* prominently in all of these books?
questions.explanation:
Harriet Vane.

	In "Strong Poison", Harriet is accused of murdering her former lover, Phillip. Lord Peter solves the case and clears her name, however, and proposes to her, but she refuses. Then, in "Have His Carcass", Harriet discovers a dead body while out for a stroll. She and Lord Peter crack a perplexing code and solve the case.Lord Peter propses frequently in this one, as well, but Harriet refuses each time. Finally, in "Gaudy Night" they work a case involving anonymous, threatening letters. He pops the question at the end, and she finally says yes. "Busman's Honeymoon" is about their honeymoon. There has also been a partially-finished manuscript that Dorothy L. Sayers began about Peter and Harriet's married life after "Busman's Honeymoon", which was completed by Jill Walsh and published in 2001. It's called "Thrones, Dominations", and is an excellent book.

questions.text: In "Strong Poison", Inspector Parker, one of Lord Peter's good friends, confesses that he has a crush on Mary. Who is Mary?
options: A lady Inspector Parker met at the police station.
questions.explanation:
Lord Peter's sister.

	Inspector Parker says that he's liked her for a long time, but he was too afraid to tell her. Lord Peter responds by saying that if Parker doesn't tell her, he himself will.

questions.text: One of the characters in "Murder Must Advertise" is Miss Parton, who works at Pym's Publicity, Ltd. What is her job?
questions.explanation:
Typist.

	Miss Parton is one of the typists at Pym's.

questions.text: What was the name of Lord Peter's first love? (Hint: He mentions her occasionally, but their love affair is never actually described in any of the books.)
questions.explanation:
Barbara.

	Lord Peter tells Harriet about her, and occasionally, in some of the books, he says things like, "Ah, Barbara, I suppose you fancied someone else."

questions.text: Who turns out to be the "Poison-Pen" in "Gaudy Night"?
questions.explanation:
Annie & Annie Wilson.

	Annie is one of the scouts at Shrewsbury College (invented by Sayers) at Oxford University. Near the end, when Lord Peter accuses her, she admits that she did it.

questions.text: Who is the murderer of the unidentified body in "Whose Body?"?
questions.explanation:
Sir Julian Freke.

	Sir Julian killed the man, dumped his body in another guy's bathtub, and put a gold pince-nez on the body's nose.

Photography.

	Lord Peter often uses Bunter to take pictures of crime scenes.

questions.text: Which character is introduced in "Unnatural Death", and is a great help to Lord Peter in some of the books following that?
questions.explanation:
Miss Climpson.

	Miss Climpson is an elderly lady who does a lot of undercover investigating for Lord Peter, and is FOND of ITALICS in SPEAKING and WRITING!

questions.text: In "Murder Must Advertise", who kills Victor Dean?
questions.explanation:
Mr. Tallboy

	Victor Dean was blackmailing Tallboy, who was involved in the dope traffic. Thank you for playing my quiz. :-)
